conclusion: Identify the initial position and shape of shadows
Shadow A (birdcage) is positioned to the right and slightly below the birdcage
Shadow B (crumpled paper) is positioned to the left and below the crumpled paper
Shadow C (wooden spoon) is positioned to the right and below the wooden spoon
Understand the effect of moving the light source to the right
Shadows will be cast to the left of the objects when the light source moves to the right
Shadow A will shift to the left side of the birdcage
Shadow B will shift to the left side of the crumpled paper
Shadow C will shift to the left side of the wooden spoon
Analyze the change in shadow size
Shadow A will become shorter and wider due to the new angle of the light
Shadow B will become shorter and wider
Shadow C will become more elongated in the direction opposite to the light source
Summarize the changes in position and size of shadows
All shadows will move to the left of their respective objects
Shadows may become shorter and wider or more elongated, depending on the object's shape
Conclusion: Shadows A, B, and C will shift to the left and may change in size when the light source moves to the right
